page.title: 18RIVER STOUR
page.content: The River Stour flows into the sea just east of Richbourgh Power Station. Many small pleasure boats sail up and down the Stour. Larger boats such as waste-paper boats, small coastal oil tankers and timber boats can reach as far as the town of Sandwich. Beacons have been set up to guide large boats away from the muddy banks. On the south bank is Shell Ness which is maintained by the N.T. and Kent Trust for Nature Conservation and the R.S.P.B. and has been made into a restricted area and Nature Reserve. Access to the Shell Ness is only possible from Sandwich as there is no bridge.The spit which forms Shell Ness is set aside mainly for the Sandwich Tern and Kentish Plover which breed there regularly each year.
